Greg J. Wild

HomeBlog

All things Greg J. Wild, all the time.

Need someone who can help your users make the most of your tech product? I'm pretty good at that.

  • Technical support? Sure!
  • Technical writing? Yup.
  • Content & product strategy? Those too.
  • And, I'm not a bad programmer either.

I'm user focused, but data driven. I work well in cross-functional teams.

I'm ideally placed to support users and speak truth to product.

Things I've worked on

As an inveterate technology generalist, I've got a track record in seeing the forest and the trees. I'm good at understand the promise of a technology, and how it fits into the bigger picture. I think my career development reflects this!

Hotjar -- Product Support Specialist

Starting out in the Customer Support team back in 2018, when we were still being called Customer Heros, my initial remit was simple: help users get the most out of Hotjar!

During 2019 My experience with content development made me ideally placed for helping with the task of writing content for the knowledge base.

As 2020 came around, I was partnered up with the recordings team, as a Product Support Specialist charged with making sure the Support team was ready and able to provide support for this crucial piece of the product. I routinely help inform the product team of user frustrations, helping to inform the direction of the product.

Manning Publications Co. -- Acquisition Editor

As one of the best loved publishers of books on software development, I was responsible for commissioning books across a wide range of products. I researched the market, and sourced authors. A year or so into my time at Manning, I was made responsible for leading Manning's initial charge into video course production: almost all of its initial range of videos were commissioned by me. I was never been able to tally up the final totals, and a lot of my best products were published after I finished at Manning but I'm reasonably sure products I commissioned generated maybe a couple of million dollars over their lifetimes.

Packt Publishing -- Acquisition Editor

Here's where my professional career really began. I learned the art of commissioning books, and I really developed an appreciation for the software industry. In my time at Packt, I worked on around 100 books, over the course of just under 2 years.

University of Nottingham -- Masters Degree - Social and Global Justice - Merit

Studying in the department of Politics and International relations, I focused primarily on studying the politics of revolution, rebellion, and civil war. With a dissertation dissecting the role of technology on the Egyptian Revolution of 2011 during the Arab Spring, I truly began to appreciate the transformative power of technology.

University of Reading -- Bachelor's Degree - Ancient History - First Class

I've always been a history nerd. Here I focused some of the less well known sub-groups of Ancient Greece, such as Macedon, Thessaly, and Epirus.

Things I'm interested in

  • Politics
  • Technology
  • History
  • PC Gaming
  • Running
